explanation: The report is correct. In OS_SelectSingle_Impl the variable impl is declared as OS_impl_file_internal_record_t * and is initialized from OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(...). The code only reads fields from impl (impl->selectable and impl->fd) and never modifies the pointed-at object. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 says a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible, so impl should be declared as a pointer-to-const (const OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl) in this function. Assigning the address of a modifiable table element (the macro yields OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *) to a pointer-to-const is allowed, so the fix is local (change the impl declaration or have the macro yield a pointer-to-const). The fact that the underlying table is non-const does not prevent this function from using a const-qualified pointer when it only needs read access. Therefore the reported violation is valid.
